meanings.definition: A hypothetical unit of time in quantum physics.
meanings.sent1: In quantum physics, scientists study the concept of a chronon to understand time better.
meanings.sent2: The chronon is a crucial concept in quantum physics, helping researchers delve into the mysteries of time.
meanings.sent3: When the professor mentioned the chronon in class, the students were puzzled by this strange unit of time.
meanings.sent4: The chronon acts like a tiny timekeeper, ticking away in the quantum realm.
meanings.sent5: Imagining a chronon as a minuscule time atom can make the concept easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: The smallest possible unit of time in a physical system.
meanings.sent1: In a physical system, time can be broken down into the smallest unit called a chronon.
meanings.sent2: Scientists believe that the chronon is the tiniest fragment of time that can exist in the physical world.
meanings.sent3: When the stopwatch malfunctioned, it started measuring time in chronons, causing confusion among the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The chronon is like the invisible building block of time, too small to be seen or measured directly.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing a chronon as a microscopic time grain can help understand its significance in time measurement.

meanings.definition: A fundamental unit of time in the study of time perception.
meanings.sent1: Psychologists use the concept of a chronon as a fundamental time unit to explore human time perception.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the chronon is essential in studying how humans perceive and process time.
meanings.sent3: When the clock suddenly skipped a chronon, it felt like time had momentarily paused for the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The chronon is like the building block of our perception of time, shaping our understanding of temporal experiences.
meanings.sent5: Thinking of a chronon as the heartbeat of time perception can illuminate its role in our daily lives.
